study.title: Microbiology testing capacity and antimicrobial drug resistance in surgical-site infections: a post-hoc, prospective, secondary analysis of the FALCON randomised trial in seven low-income and middle-income countries
authors: NIHR Global Health Research Unit on Global Surgery

design.inclusion_criteria_text: All eligible, consecutive patients undergoing abdominal surgery with an incision of 5 cm or greater. Clean operations (gastrointestinal tract not entered) were excluded.
design.exclusion_criteria_text: Patients undergoing clean operations (gastrointestinal tract not entered). Entries missing SSI status were excluded.
design.duplicate_rationale: No evidence of overlapping cohorts; primary FALCON trial previously published, this is a secondary analysis.

country_specific_sites: 54 hospitals in Benin, Ghana, India, Mexico, Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa

eligibility.population: Patients undergoing abdominal surgery with incision ≥5 cm, excluding clean operations.
eligibility.intervention: Perioperative antibiotic prophylaxis (various regimens), skin preparation (2% alcoholic chlorhexidine or 10% aqueous povidone–iodine), suture type (triclosan-coated or non-coated).
eligibility.comparator: Alternative skin preparation and suture types; antibiotic regimens as per local practice.

definitions.resistance_definition_text: MDR defined as acquired non-susceptibility to at least one agent in three or more antimicrobial categories (CDC/ECDC criteria).
definitions.outcome_definitions_text: Mortality: 30-day all-cause; Reoperation/readmission: within 30 days; LOS not reported; Cost not reported.

lab_methods.specimen_collection_method: Wound swab taken from SSI site; decision to swab determined by local clinical practice, patient choice, or ability to afford test.
lab_methods.culture_method: Local microbiology facilities; aerobic and anaerobic culture; blood agar, MacConkey agar, cooked meat media.
lab_methods.organism_identification_method: Standard bacteriological test; Analytical profile index in some cases.
lab_methods.contamination_handling: Non-bacterial isolates (e.g., yeast) excluded from analysis.
lab_methods.lab_capacity_notes: Testing capacity limited; 15 hospitals lacked capacity, 35 had capacity but did not always perform swabs.

ssi_incidence.notes: SSI defined by CDC criteria; denominator is patients with available data.

provenance.text_snippet: Overall, 1163 of 5284 patients (22·0% [95% CI 20·9–23·2]) at 50 hospitals were diagnosed with an SSI in the FALCON trial.

codes.summary: Testing capacity for microbiological analysis of SSI is low, with only 19.6% of SSI patients having a wound swab taken; turnaround time for results is often ≥48 hours.

evidence_quotes.quote: 228 of 1163 (19·6% [17·4–22·0]) had a wound swab taken.
Turnaround time (from sending the wound swab to receiving the results) was reported to be 48 h or longer in 149 of 200 cases (74·5%) and 72 h or longer in 75 of 200 cases (37·5%).
